trans-unit.source: Linking guidance for Azure technical content
trans-unit.target: Linking guidance for Azure technical content

trans-unit.source: Guidelines for technical articles on azure.microsoft.com
trans-unit.target: Guidelines for technical articles on azure.microsoft.com

trans-unit.source: Link scenario
trans-unit.target: Link scenario

trans-unit.source: Guidance
trans-unit.target: Guidance

trans-unit.source: Linking from an ACOM article to another ACOM article
trans-unit.target: Linking from an ACOM article to another ACOM article

trans-unit.source: Use relative links.
trans-unit.target: Use relative links.

trans-unit.source: Do not include the en-us language locale in your relative links.
trans-unit.target: Do not include the en-us language locale in your relative links.

trans-unit.source: Linking to an MSDN library topic, a TechNet library topic, or KB article
trans-unit.target: Linking to an MSDN library topic, a TechNet library topic, or KB article

trans-unit.source: ​Use the actual link to the article or topic, but remove the en-us language locale from the link.
trans-unit.target: ​Use the actual link to the article or topic, but remove the en-us language locale from the link.

trans-unit.source: Linking from an ACOM article to any other web page
trans-unit.target: Linking from an ACOM article to any other web page

trans-unit.source: Use the direct link
trans-unit.target: Use the direct link

trans-unit.source: Markdown syntax for ACOM relative links
trans-unit.target: Markdown syntax for ACOM relative links

trans-unit.source: To create an inline link from an ACOM technical article to another ACOM technical article, use this link format.
trans-unit.target: To create an inline link from an ACOM technical article to another ACOM technical article, use this link format.

trans-unit.source: If you create any new links to or from articles in the directories, you’ll need to follow the new linking syntax.
trans-unit.target: If you create any new links to or from articles in the directories, you’ll need to follow the new linking syntax.

trans-unit.target: Article in a directory links to another article in the same directory:

trans-unit.source: You do not have to create anchors anymore - they are automatically generated at publishing time for all H2 headings.
trans-unit.target: You do not have to create anchors anymore - they are automatically generated at publishing time for all H2 headings.

trans-unit.source: The only thing you have to do is create links to the H2 sections:
trans-unit.target: The only thing you have to do is create links to the H2 sections:

trans-unit.source: Custom markdown link syntax
trans-unit.target: Custom markdown link syntax

trans-unit.source: Since includes files are located in another directory, you will need to use relative paths as below.
trans-unit.target: Since includes files are located in another directory, you will need to use relative paths as below.

trans-unit.source: For a link to a single article from an includes file, use this format:
trans-unit.target: For a link to a single article from an includes file, use this format:

trans-unit.source: Learn more about how to use an includes file in the [Custom markdown extensions guidelines](custom-markdown-extensions.md#includes).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about how to use an includes file in the [Custom markdown extensions guidelines](custom-markdown-extensions.md#includes).

trans-unit.source: If you have selectors embedded in an include, you would use this sort of linking:
trans-unit.target: If you have selectors embedded in an include, you would use this sort of linking:

trans-unit.source: To link to a page on ACOM (such as a pricing page, SLA page or anything else that is not a documentation article), use an absolute URL, but omit the locale.
trans-unit.target: To link to a page on ACOM (such as a pricing page, SLA page or anything else that is not a documentation article), use an absolute URL, but omit the locale.

trans-unit.source: The goal here is that links work in GitHub and on the rendered site:
trans-unit.target: The goal here is that links work in GitHub and on the rendered site:

trans-unit.source: To test your links, push your page to your fork and view it in the rendered view and publish to Sandbox.
trans-unit.target: To test your links, push your page to your fork and view it in the rendered view and publish to Sandbox.

trans-unit.source: The cross links on the GitHub version of the page should work as long as the targets of the URLs are present in your fork.
trans-unit.target: The cross links on the GitHub version of the page should work as long as the targets of the URLs are present in your fork.

trans-unit.source: Our [markdown template for technical articles](../markdown templates/markdown-template-for-new-articles.md/) shows an alternate way to create crosslinks in markdown so all the crosslinks are coded together at the end of the article, even while they display inline.
trans-unit.target: Our [markdown template for technical articles](../markdown templates/markdown-template-for-new-articles.md/) shows an alternate way to create crosslinks in markdown so all the crosslinks are coded together at the end of the article, even while they display inline.

trans-unit.source: Reference-style links
trans-unit.target: Reference-style links

trans-unit.source: You can use reference style links to make your source content easier to read.
trans-unit.target: You can use reference style links to make your source content easier to read.

trans-unit.source: The reference style links replace the inline link syntax with simplified syntax that allows you to move the long URLs to the end of the article.
trans-unit.target: The reference style links replace the inline link syntax with simplified syntax that allows you to move the long URLs to the end of the article.

trans-unit.source: Here's Daring Fireball's example:
trans-unit.target: Here's Daring Fireball's example:

trans-unit.source: Inline text:
trans-unit.target: Inline text:

trans-unit.source: Link references at the end of the article:
trans-unit.target: Link references at the end of the article:

trans-unit.source: Remember the Azure library chrome!
trans-unit.target: Remember the Azure library chrome!

trans-unit.source: If you want to link to an Azure library topic that lives under [this node](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure), remember to specify the Azure chrome in the link (/azure/).
trans-unit.target: If you want to link to an Azure library topic that lives under [this node](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure), remember to specify the Azure chrome in the link (/azure/).

trans-unit.source: The Azure chrome shares the ACOM navigation options and displays only the Azure content of the MSDN library.
trans-unit.target: The Azure chrome shares the ACOM navigation options and displays only the Azure content of the MSDN library.

trans-unit.source: A properly scoped link looks like this:
trans-unit.target: A properly scoped link looks like this:

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, the page will be rendered in the standard MSDN view, with the entire MSDN tree displayed.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, the page will be rendered in the standard MSDN view, with the entire MSDN tree displayed.

trans-unit.source: FWLinks
trans-unit.target: FWLinks

trans-unit.source: Avoid FWLinks (our redirection system) in azure.microsoft.com content.
trans-unit.target: Avoid FWLinks (our redirection system) in azure.microsoft.com content.

trans-unit.source: They should be used only as a last resort when you need to create a link for a page whose URL you don't yet know.
trans-unit.target: They should be used only as a last resort when you need to create a link for a page whose URL you don't yet know.

trans-unit.source: They are almost never actually needed.
trans-unit.target: They are almost never actually needed.

trans-unit.source: For ACOM, you define the file name, so you can know what it will be ahead of time.
trans-unit.target: For ACOM, you define the file name, so you can know what it will be ahead of time.

trans-unit.source: For a library topic that is not yet published, you can create a link that uses the topic GUID so that you don't have to use an FWLink.
trans-unit.target: For a library topic that is not yet published, you can create a link that uses the topic GUID so that you don't have to use an FWLink.

trans-unit.source: If you must use an FWLink on a web page, include the P parameter to make it a permanent redirect:
trans-unit.target: If you must use an FWLink on a web page, include the P parameter to make it a permanent redirect:

trans-unit.source: When you paste the target URL into the FWLink tool, remember to remove the locale if your target link is ACOM, or the MSDN or TechNet library.
trans-unit.target: When you paste the target URL into the FWLink tool, remember to remove the locale if your target link is ACOM, or the MSDN or TechNet library.
